page.title: 19THE KIRN AT SANDWICK
page.content: On the Ness of Cumliewick there is a large hole known as the kirn. The hole is approx.30ft. in diameter. There is a cave in the cliffs nearby and on a calm day a small boat can go into the cave and after travelling in the dark tunnel will reach the kirn. We tried throwing stones into the kirn and listening to hear the echoes and the length of time taken for the stones to reach the bottom. Nowadays the kirn is fenced to prevent sheep and visitors falling in. There is a story that a long time ago a ship was wrecked on the headland and the sailors scrambled ashore.They formed a line, holding hands, and proceeded towards a light in the distance. Those in the middle of the line fell into the kirn and only those on the end survived to tell the story.
